intro: Tiquilia nesiotica, commonly known as the narrowleaf tiquilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Tiquilia nesiotica is a perennial shrub that produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
